title: Filter chip
description: A compact element that allows users to filter content by selecting or deselecting criteria

frontMatter.title: Filter chip
frontMatter.description: A compact element that allows users to filter content by selecting or deselecting criteria

when_to_use.value: **Filtering lists or search results**: Use filter chips when users need to narrow down content based on multiple criteria
**Tag-based filtering**: When content is categorized with tags that users can select to filter
**Multi-select filters**: When users should be able to apply multiple filters simultaneously

when_to_consider_else.value: **Single selection**: If only one option can be selected at a time, consider radio buttons or a select dropdown
**Primary actions**: Don't use filter chips for primary actions; use buttons instead
**Navigation**: Use tabs or links for navigation between different views

behavior.value: Filter chips toggle between selected and unselected states when clicked
Selected chips should have a distinct visual treatment (e.g., filled background, checkmark icon)
Chips should be dismissible when in the selected state
Changes should be reflected immediately in the filtered content

content_considerations.value: Keep chip labels short and descriptive (1-3 words)
Be specific about what the filter does
Avoid jargon or technical terms users won't understand

accessibility.value: Chips should announce their label and current state (selected/not selected)
State changes should be announced when toggled
Use `aria-pressed` to indicate the selected state
Ensure sufficient color contrast for both states
